cleavage noun [C or U]
(OF CELL)
biology
  specialized the division of a cell, especially an egg cell after it has been fertilized: It was easy to identify pairs of cells which had just undergone cleavage. the cleavage stage of sea urchin embryos
More examplesFewer examplesWe found no significant difference in cleavage rate between the two types of cell.Cleavage progression was geometric, at least for the first 64 cells. Cleavages of early embryos occur by mitosis.
